xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 20 May 2014
xwikidoc.content: <mcupak> has quit 09:36 <mcupak> has quit 10:35 <akats> has joined #phenotips 11:34 <akats> Are there calculations made for left/right hand length? I see only - instead of a usual percentile number calculation 11:35 <sdumitriu> There should be 12:18 <akats> Its a bug in a newer build 12:19 <akats> It's fairly recent 12:19 <akats> Maybe in the last 2 weeks 12:19 <sdumitriu> Hm... 12:19 <sdumitriu> Nothing changed there 12:20 <sdumitriu> Indeed, it doesn't work on Playground either 12:21 <sdumitriu> Can you debug it? 12:22 <akats> Yes 12:22 <akats> It's somewhere in the /bin/get/PhenoTips/PatientToolsService 12:22 <akats> shall I make a separate issue? 12:22 <sdumitriu> Yes 12:22 <akats> ok 12:27 <sdumitriu> akats: Did you look into https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/issues/756 at some point? 12:28 <akats> Nope. 12:29 <akats> First time I see the github page 12:29 <sdumitriu> OK 12:29 <akats> Do you want to assign it to me? 12:30 <sdumitriu> Nope 12:52 <akats> found the issue. 12:52 <akats> the data array for hands is sparce 12:52 <akats> so it goes 24, 48, etc 12:52 <akats> whereas weight for example is continious 12:53 <akats> the current code can't work with sparce arrays 12:53 <sdumitriu> It used to work with gaps... 12:54 <akats> https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/blob/master/components/patient-measurements/api/src/main/java/org/phenotips/measurements/internal/AbstractMeasurementHandler.java#L241 12:54 <akats> Thats the problem 12:55 <akats> but it is not the code that changed 12:56 <sdumitriu> Oh, I see, the issue is that there's no measurement for 0 months 12:56 <sdumitriu> It only works from 2 years upwards 16:04 <akats> sdumitriu: I'm looking into this issue right now https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/issues/93. I'm also remember you talking about having to make the csv export nicer with several lines per patient. 16:05 <akats> Thinking of how these problems can be implemented, I started wondering if it would be better to use a spreadsheet generation library 16:10 <sdumitriu1> Yes, we could 16:10 <sdumitriu1> It's quite simple to use 16:11 <sdumitriu1> I think we already have the libraries for that in the application 16:11 <sdumitriu1> You can look into http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LiveTableExcelExport+Macro 16:12 <sdumitriu1> Not to use it directly, but to see how to create an excel file 16:12 <sdumitriu1> http://poi.apache.org/ 16:13 <sdumitriu1> akats: It looks like I'm not coming back today after all 16:14 <akats> I see. Are you ok to chat though or are you busy? 16:35 <sdumitriu1> A bit later 16:38 <akats> Ok. Well I'll just outline what I'm thinking 16:40 <akats> - Should we write to both Microsoft and Open/Libre office formats? 16:43 <akats> Should we use newer or older formats? 16:43 <mcupak> has quit 16:55 <akats> Is it really worth it to switch? The real power of not using csv comes from the ability to have cells with column span and text formatting 16:55 <akats> Column span would be really nice to subdivide phenotype column into more columns 16:56 <akats> And formatting text would be nice for making the document much more readable on the whole 16:57 <akats> I'm wondering just how often do doctors export data? Or if not often, how important is it to have good export? 17:30 <akats> The conclusion that I have arrived at: If export is an important feature, we should definitely make the switch. The ease of reading a spreadsheet is probably times better when there is formatting present such as font weight, style, color, size, borders, column widths and row eights. 17:30 <akats> It would make sense to ship out only microsoft format as the quality of conversion seems ok now 17:34 <sdumitriu1> I think new format 17:35 <sdumitriu1> And both ODS and XLSX 17:36 <akats> Ok. Since this is the only issue I have that I can work on I just want to know if you want me to implement the library or to hack what we have now 17:36 <akats> So that when I come in tomorrow I have something to work on 17:36 <sdumitriu1> Many european countries want a "standard" format for government documents 17:36 <sdumitriu1> And OD* is that format 17:36 <sdumitriu1> Implement what library? 17:37 <akats> well we'll probably have to either implement 2 (poi and http://incubator.apache.org/odftoolkit/odfdom/index.html) 17:37 <akats> or implement poi and a converter 17:37 <sdumitriu1> You don't implement POI, you use it 17:38 <akats> Sorry, I meant implement using 17:38 <sdumitriu1> Implementing new format would be better 17:40 <akats> Ok. I'll start on it tomorrow. I'll try to make flexible. To reasonable limits of course. 17:43 <akats> has quit 18:57 <vijay13> has quit 19:59 <vijay13> has quit
